title: Ticket #6741: Implement Python bindings tests into condor_tests suite
description:
We have no continuous integration testing for the Python bindings. Brian Bockelman wrote some tests under /src/python-bindings/tests but these need to be run manually. Let's translate these so they run automatically under condor_tests.

We'll group them into modules structured the same way they are now. For example I'll start by implementing the classad test: python_bindings_classad.run. If any of the unit tests fail, we'll consider the whole module test failed. The stdout logging will indicate which specific unit tests caused it.
remarks:
2018-Oct-01 15:55:51 by tlmiller:
See #3878, for reference.

2018-Oct-01 16:17:38 by tlmiller:
FYI: I cherry-picked all of the changes on the branch onto 8.7.10.

Notes on the quick hack, reference build ID 451062:

General

We use the Linux path separator to construct some constants. We should probably just use Perl's path concatenation function. (Or rewrite the whole thing in Python, but MarkC's already working on that.)

Each of these would require further investigation; I'm only posting them here in case what I've seen ends up being useful to MarkC in his efforts, or if the hack test remains active for rather longer than I'm currently anticipating.

Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7 (htcondor) 

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\condor\execute\dir_1168\userdir\condor_tests\python_bindings\htcondor_tests.py", line 5, in <module>
    import pwd
ImportError: No module named pwd

May be related to expected bug composing paths on Windows.

Debian 9 

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/slots/03/dir_15670/userdir/condor_tests/python_bindings/htcondor_tests.py", line 689, in testTransaction
    self.assertEqual(len(ads), 0)
AssertionError: 1 != 0

This looks like the test didn't wait long enough for the job to exit the queue, given that the other tests all succeeded.

MacOSX 10 

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Volumes/MacintoshHD2/condor/slot3/dir_57402/userdir/condor_tests/python_bindings/htcondor_tests.py", line 623, in testTransaction
    self.launch_daemons(["SCHEDD", "COLLECTOR", "STARTD", "NEGOTIATOR"])
  File "/Volumes/MacintoshHD2/condor/slot3/dir_57402/userdir/condor_tests/python_bindings/htcondor_tests.py", line 131, in launch_daemons
    self.waitLocalDaemon(daemon)
  File "/Volumes/MacintoshHD2/condor/slot3/dir_57402/userdir/condor_tests/python_bindings/htcondor_tests.py", line 150, in waitLocalDaemon
    raise RuntimeError("Waiting for daemon %s timed out." % daemon)
RuntimeError: Waiting for daemon SCHEDD timed out.

This may just be load on the system, given that the other tests all succeeded.

Redhat 7

This failure was epic, but characterized by connectivity issues, which seems odd. Maybe a firewall issue?

Ubuntu 16

Also an epic failure: every daemon start-up timed out. No idea what happened here. (

Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7 (classad) 

Can't spawn "timed_cmd.exe -jgd -v -o python_bindings_classad.run.out -t 12M python python_bindings_classad.run": No such file or directory at run_test.pl line 415, <TF> line 509.
             python_bindings_classad.run run_test 336: 13:14:37 python_bindings_classad.run FAILED

Not sure what happened here. Some sort of PATH or path issue preventing test start-up.
